verses.roman:
kabhu śasya khāñā punaḥ pātra bhare śāṁse
śraddhā bāḍe paṇḍitera, prema-sindhu bhāse

synonyms: kabhu—sometimes; śasya khāñā—eating the pulp; punaḥ—again; pātra—the plate; bhare—fills; śāṁse—with pulp; śraddhā—faith; bāḍe—increases; paṇḍitera—of Rāghava Paṇḍita; prema-sindhu—in the ocean of love; bhāse—floats.
translation: "Sometimes, after eating the pulp, Kṛṣṇa would fill the plate again with new pulp. In this way, Rāghava Paṇḍita's faith increases, and he floats in an ocean of love.
